channel.title: Susy on Andrew Fowlie
channel.description: Recent content in Susy on Andrew Fowlie

item.title: BayesFits (2009 - 2013)
item.description: During my PhD I was involved with BayesFits, lead by Prof. Roszkowski. We published high-impact analyses of simple SUSY models in light of LHC searches for SUSY and the Higgs discovery [1, 2, 3].

item.title: Fine-tuning and naturalness
item.description: Fine-tuning of the weak-scale was traditionally measured by the Barbieri-Giudice measure $$ \Delta = \frac{\partial\ln M_Z^2}{\partial \ln m_{\textrm{soft}}} $$ In a series of papers [1, 2, 3, 4, 5], I have argued that our intuitve ideas about fine-tuning are captured formally in Bayesian statistics.
